content.title: Tax Efficiency & Savings Recommendations
bullets: Maximize tax savings by utilizing available deductions under sections 80C, 80D, and 80CCD(1B).
Consider LTCG harvesting to optimize tax liability on capital gains.
paragraphs: To optimize your tax savings, it is crucial to take advantage of the deductions available under sections 80C, 80D, and 80CCD(1B). Additionally, if you have any unrealized long-term capital gains, consider harvesting them to make full use of the ₹1.25 lakh exemption limit. This strategy will help you minimize your tax liability effectively.

actions.action: 80C: Invest ₹1,50,000 in ELSS or PPF by March 31st to save ₹46,800 in taxes.
actions.details: Since you haven't claimed any deductions under 80C, you can invest up to ₹1,50,000 in eligible instruments like ELSS or PPF to save on taxes.

actions.action: 80D: Purchase a health insurance policy for yourself and family with a premium of ₹25,000 by March 31st to save ₹7,800 in taxes.
actions.details: Health insurance premiums are deductible under section 80D. This is a high-impact, low-effort way to reduce your taxable income.

actions.action: 80CCD(1B): Contribute ₹50,000 to NPS by March 31st to save ₹15,600 in taxes.
actions.details: Contributions to the National Pension System (NPS) under section 80CCD(1B) offer an additional deduction of ₹50,000, which can further reduce your tax liability.

actions.action: LTCG Harvesting: If you have unrealized long-term capital gains, sell assets to realize gains up to ₹1,25,000 by March 31st to utilize the exemption limit.
actions.details: Review your investment portfolio for any unrealized long-term capital gains. Harvesting these gains up to the exemption limit can help you avoid paying taxes on them.
